intro: Psychotria marcgraviella, commonly known as the "Marsupial Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
